{{Infobox person | name = Hampton J. Cheney | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = June 2, 1836 | birth_place = [[Rapides Parish, Louisiana]], U.S. | death_date = September 12, 1927 | death_place = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = | education = [[Western Military Institute]] | alma mater = | employer = | occupation = Politician | title = | salary = | networth = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = Amanda E. Stratton | children = 1 daughter | parents = Hampton J. Cheney | relatives = }} '''Hampton J. Cheney''' (1836-1927) was an American Confederate veteran and politician. He served as a member of the [[Tennessee Senate]].
==Early life== Hampton J. Cheney was born on June 2, 1836 in [[Rapides Parish, Louisiana]].<ref name="allison56">{{cite book|last1=Allison|first1=John|title=Notable Men of Tennessee: Personal and Genealogical, with portraits|date=1905|publisher=Southern historical Association|location=Atlanta, Georgia|pages=56-57|oclc=2561350|url=https://archive.org/stream/bub_gb_Fag-AAAAYAAJ#page/n53/mode/2up|via=[[Internet Archive]]}}</ref> He graduated from the [[Western Military Institute]] in 1858.<ref name="allison56"/>
==Career== Cheney became a farmer.<ref name="allison56"/> During the [[American Civil War]] of 1861-1865, he served as adjutant under General [[John C. Brown]] in the [[Confederate States Army]].<ref name="allison56"/><ref name="losson276">{{cite book|last1=Losson|first1=Christopher|title=Tennessee's Forgotten Warriors: Frank Cheatham and His Confederate Division|date=1989|publisher=University of Tennessee Press|location=Knoxville, Tennessee|isbn=9780870496158|oclc=19742044|page=276|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=g5DTDdArMoQC&pg=PA276&lpg=PA276&dq=Hampton+J.+Cheney&source=bl&ots=9wyfjeINrc&sig=rRdt2Xv19Ch7tYV7pDPMTUb-Bpg&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjFpsK6u6rPAhWIDsAKHXDCBrgQ6AEIIzAB#v=onepage&q=Hampton%20J.%20Cheney&f=false}}</ref>
Cheney served as assistant postmaster of Nashville from 1888 to 1892.<ref name="losson276"/><ref name="tnportraitcheney">{{cite web|title=Tennessee State Museum: Cheney, Hampton J.|url=http://www.tnportraits.org/7624-cheney-hampton-j.htm|website=Tennessee Portrait Project|accessdate=September 25, 2016|publisher=National Society of Colonial Dames of America in Tennessee}}</ref> He served as a member of the [[Tennessee Senate]] in 1892.<ref name="allison56"/> He served as the City Comptroller of Nashville from 1898 to 1906.<ref name="allison56"/><ref name="tnportraitcheney"/>
==Personal life and death== Cheney married Amanda E. Stratton, the daughter of Colonel Madison Stratton, in 1858.<ref name="allison56"/> They had a daughter, Leonora.<ref name="allison56"/> He was a member of the [[Improved Order of Red Men]], the [[Fraternal Order of Eagles]] and the [[Knights of Pythias]].<ref name="allison56"/> He was also a member of the [[United Confederate Veterans]].<ref name="allison56"/>
Cheney died on September 12, 1927 in Nashville, Tennessee. His portrait is displayed at the [[Tennessee State Museum]].<ref name="tnportraitcheney"/>
